noun.description: Roman Law. A person who acts as a second stipulator in a contract or bargain.

origin: Mid 17th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin adstipulātor (also astipulātor) (in legal context) associate in a stipulation, (in general context) person who supports an opinion, adherent from astipulāt-, past participial stem of astipulārī + -or.
